zone.line: Tis your custom sweetest child to describe
to me the objects that give you delight
you array them in the soft radiance
whilst you speak
of your words. & I only feel the infirmity
-mity which holds me in such dear
dependence as a blessing. Why have
you been silent now.
I know not — first the wonder &
pleasure of this sight, then the words
of the stranger, & then, thinking on
what he had said & how he looked — &
now beloved father your own words.
speak no more
Well, I am silent now. What do you
see?
I see a great circle of arches built
& walls giddily hanging upon walls
crags
upon arches, & stones like shattered overhanging
-anging the solid wall. In the crevices
